blocks.text: Technical controls are controls that are implemented using technology. These include firewalls, antivirus software, endpoint protection, encryption systems, and access control mechanisms built into operating systems and applications.

Managerial controls (also called administrative controls) involve policies, procedures, and governance. Examples include security policies, risk management processes, hiring practices, and vendor agreements.
Operational controls rely on people and processes. Examples include security guards, employee training, incident response procedures, and background checks.
Physical controls protect facilities and equipment. Examples include locks, fences, surveillance cameras, lighting, badge readers, and biometric door systems.
Most organizations use a combination of all four categories to protect their environment, since relying on only one category creates single points of failure.
